Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure in Tanagra style. Broken with only top right side preserved. Mould-made and hollow with white (gypsum?) coating. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop that was operational from the 3rd to the 2nd century BC (see 3rd century BC examples in Bailey 2008, no. 3515 and 3516). 3rd century BC parallels of this headdress (but finer quality) in Stuttgart and Dresden (Fischer 1994, no. 166-8). Mid to late 3rd century BC parallels from Hadra, Alexandria (Tezgör 2007, nos. 230, see also 228, 231). Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen. Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie : figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo : Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.408) (Phase 1)
